title: JPMorgan Earnings, Revenue beat In Q3
text:
© Reuters. JPMorgan Earnings, Revenue beat In Q3

Investing.com - JPMorgan (NYSE: ) reported third quarter that beat analysts' expectations on Tuesday and revenue that topped forecasts.

The firm reported earnings per share of $2.68 on revenue of $30.06B. Analysts polled by Investing.com expected EPS of $2.45 on revenue of $28.46B. That compared to EPS of $2.34 on revenue of $27.82B in the same period a year earlier. The company had reported EPS of $2.82 on revenue of $29.57B in the previous quarter.

For the year, JPMorgan shares are up 19.29%, outperforming the S&P Global (NYSE: ) 100 which is up 15.57% year to date.

JPMorgan follows other major Financial sector earnings this month

On Tuesday, UnitedHealth reported third quarter EPS of $3.88 on revenue of $60.35B, compared to forecasts of EPS of $3.75 on revenue of $59.75B.

BlackRock earnings beat analyst's expectations on Tuesday, with third quarter EPS of $7.15 on revenue of $3.69B. Investing.com analysts expected EPS of $6.96 on revenue of $3.68B

Stay up-to-date on all of the upcoming earnings reports by visiting Investing.com's earnings calendar
description: JPMorgan Earnings, Revenue beat In Q3
